Welcome August 26, 2021 · One min read Vijay Reddy Gaddam Maintainer of blazorbootstrap Vikram Reddy Gaddam Maintainer of blazorbootstrap Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config. Well done!

Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.

Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.

Click event​

Copy @code{ protected void OnClick(EventArgs args) { Console.WriteLine("click event"); }} Copy Double click event​

Copy @code{ protected void OnDoubleClick(EventArgs args) { Console.WriteLine("double click event"); }} Copy Click event with arguments​

Copy @code{ public string message = "Test message"; protected void OnClickWithArgs(EventArgs args, string message) { Console.WriteLine($"message: {message}"); }} Copy
<Button Color="ButtonColor.Primary" @onclick="(async () => { await ShowModalAsync(); })">Show Modal</Button><Modal @ref="modal"> ... design your header and body</Modal> Copy

Method Description Show Manually opens a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown (i.e. before the Shown event occurs). Hide Manually hides a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been hidden (i.e. before the Hidden event occurs). @code { private Modal modal; private async Task ShowModalAsync() { await modal?.ShowAsync(); } private async Task HideModalAsync() { await modal?.HideAsync(); }} Copy

Event Description Showing This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called. Shown This event is fired when an offcanvas element has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete). Hiding This event is fired immediately when the hide method has been called. Hidden This event is fired when an offcanvas element has been hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete). HidePrevented This event is fired when the modal is shown, its backdrop is static and a click outside the modal or an escape key press is performed with the keyboard option or data-bs-keyboard set to false. <Modal @ref="modal" Showing="OnModalShowingAsync" Shown="OnModalShownAsync" Hiding="OnModalHidingAsync" Hidden="OnModalHiddenAsync" HidePrevented="OnModalHidePreventedAsync"> ... design your header and body</Modal> Copy @code { private Modal modal; private async Task OnModalShowingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Showing"); }); } private async Task OnModalShownAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Show"); }); } private async Task OnModalHidingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hiding"); }); } private async Task OnModalHiddenAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hide"); }); } private async Task OnModalHidePreventedAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hide Prevented"); }); }} Copy
<Button Color="ButtonColor.Primary" @onclick="(async () => { await ShowOffcanvasAsync(); })">Show Offcanvas</Button><Offcanvas @ref="offcanvas"> ... design your header and body</Offcanvas> Copy

Method Description Show Shows an offcanvas element. Returns to the caller before the offcanvas element has actually been shown (i.e. before the Shown event occurs). Hide Hides an offcanvas element. Returns to the caller before the offcanvas element has actually been hidden (i.e. before the Hidden event occurs). @code { private Offcanvas offcanvas; private async Task ShowOffcanvasAsync() { await offcanvas?.ShowAsync(); } private async Task HideOffcanvasAsync() { await offcanvas?.HideAsync(); }} Copy

Event Description Showing This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called. Shown This event is fired when an offcanvas element has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete). Hiding This event is fired immediately when the hide method has been called. Hidden This event is fired when an offcanvas element has been hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete). <Offcanvas @ref="offcanvas" Showing="OnOffcanvasShowingAsync" Shown="OnOffcanvasShownAsync" Hiding="OnOffcanvasHidingAsync" Hidden="OnOffcanvasHiddenAsync"> ... add offcanvas header and body</Offcanvas> Copy @code { private Offcanvas offcanvas; private async Task OnOffcanvasShowingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Showing"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasShownAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Shown"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasHidingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hiding"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasHiddenAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hidden"); }); }} Copy

@using BlazorBootstrap@page "/offcanvas"

Some text as placeholder. In real life you can have the elements you have chosen. Like, text, images, lists, etc.

 Copy @code { private Offcanvas offcanvas; private async Task ShowOffcanvasAsync() { await offcanvas?.ShowAsync(); } private async Task HideOffcanvasAsync() { await offcanvas?.HideAsync(); } private async Task OnOffcanvasShowingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Showing"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasShownAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Shown"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasHidingAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hiding"); }); } private async Task OnOffcanvasHiddenAsync() { await Task.Run(() => { Console.WriteLine("Event: Hidden"); }); }} Copy
Things to know when using the toast component: Toasts will automatically hide if you do not specify AutoHide = false.

Copy List messages = new List();private void ShowToast(){ messages?.Add(new ToastMessage { Type = ToastType.Warning, IconName = IconName.Alarm, Title = "Blazor Bootstrap", HelpText = $"{DateTime.Now}", Message = $"Hello, world! This is a toast message. DateTime: {DateTime.Now}", });} Copy

Copy List messages = new List();private void ShowSimpleToast(){ messages?.Add(new ToastMessage { Type = ToastType.Success, IconName = IconName.Alarm, Message = $"Hello, world! This is a simple toast message. DateTime: {DateTime.Now}", });} Copy

Install Bootstrap Icons. Refer: Bootstrap Icons Include the icon fonts stylesheet in your website <head> or @import in CSS from CDN. <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap-icons@1.7.1/font/bootstrap-icons.css"> Copy
Name Type Descritpion Name Enum Icon Name CustomIconName string Specify custom icons of your own, like fontawesome. Example: fas fa-alarm-clock Size Enum Icon Size

Looking to quickly add BlazorBootstrap to your project? Use NuGet package manager. Install-Package Blazor.Bootstrap -Version 0.0.3 Copy

Change your index.html file and include the CSS and JS files: Add Bootstrap 5 CSS and JS files as recommended in the official Bootstrap website. Include blazor.bootstrap.js file BlazorBootstrap - Starter Template
Loading...
Copy Add BlazorBootstrap service in Program.cs public class Program{ public static async Task Main(string[] args) { var builder = WebAssemblyHostBuilder.CreateDefault(args); builder.RootComponents.Add("#app"); builder.Services.AddScoped(sp => new HttpClient { BaseAddress = new Uri(builder.HostEnvironment.BaseAddress) }); // Inject services builder.Services.AddBlazorBootstrap(); await builder.Build().RunAsync(); }} Copy
